powergrid.model

Class Point

  • java.lang.Object
    • powergrid.model.Point
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.powerbot.game.api.wrappers.Locatable

    public class Point
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.powerbot.game.api.wrappers.Locatable
    This model class represents a Point in 3D space.

    It offers many mathematical operations, such as adding / substracting other Points, multiplication with a scalar, and conversion from/to polar coordinates.

    It replaces RSBot's Tile class, yet for compatibility it still offers possibility to convert from Tile to Point (using the static fromTile(tile) method), and from Point to Tile (using the toTile() method). Point also implements RSBot's Locatable interface, allowing Points to be used in most RSBot methods as-is.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int x
      The X-coordinate of this Point
      int y
      The Y-coordinate of this Point
      int z
      The Z-coordinate of this Point (this was known as the plane in the RSBot environment)

    • Method Detail

      • getLocation

        public org.powerbot.game.api.wrappers.Tile getLocation()
        Returns the Tile corresponding to this Point, conforming to the Locatable interface.

        This makes it possible to use Points directly as Locatables in RSBot classes and methods.

        This method is effectively the same as calling toTile().

        Specified by:
        getLocation in interface org.powerbot.game.api.wrappers.Locatable
        Returns:
        a Tile object indicating the same location as this Point

      • getRegionOffset

        public org.powerbot.game.api.wrappers.RegionOffset getRegionOffset()
        returns a RegionOffset object set to (0,0,0).

        This method has no real purpose whatsoever, and is only here so that Point conforms to the Locatable interface, allowing Points to be used in RSBot methods.

        Specified by:
        getRegionOffset in interface org.powerbot.game.api.wrappers.Locatable
        Returns:
        a RegionOffset object set to (0,0,0)

        Returns:
        the distance between this Point and the Point that

      • length

        public double length()
        Calculates and returns the distance between (0,0,0) and this Point.
        Returns:
        the length of the vector denoted by this Point.

      • lengthOnPlane

        public double lengthOnPlane()
        Calculates and returns the distance between (0,0) and this Point, ignoring the plane.
        Returns:
        the length of the vector denoted by this Point, where this Point's z coordinate is ignored.

      • theta

        public double theta()
        returns the angle of the vector denoted by this Point.

        The returned angle is the angle between the vector and the x-axis. Positive angles rotate counterclockwise.

        Returns:
        the angle of the vector denoted by this Point.

      • normalize

        public Point normalize()
        returns a normalized version of this Point, treating it as a vector in 2D space (the (x,y) plane). It discards the plane information of Point, the z-coordinate of the resulting Point is 0.
        Returns:
        the normalized version of this Point

      • multiply

        public Point multiply(double s)
        returns a copy of this Point where each coordinate is multiplied with the scalar s.
        Parameters:
        s - the number to multiply this Point with
        Returns:
        a copy of this Point where each coordinate is multiplied with the scalar s

      • subtract

        public Point subtract(Point offset)
        Returns a Point that represents the position of this Point relative to offset
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset to subtract from this Point
        Returns:
        a Point representing the position of this Point relative to offset

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Returns whether this Point is equal to the given object. This Point is equal if and only if:
        • The given object is an instance of Point
        • The object points to the same position
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the Object to compare this Point with
        Returns:
        true if and only if this Point is equal to the given Object, false otherwise.
